title: How many books should a student in high school reading during the school year? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s not how many books, it’s what books you read. On top of that, it doesn’t matter what you read if you don’t enjoy it. The only thing worse than having to read a dozen books is trying to read about a boring topic. But that’s getting philosophical and what not, so I’ll just give you the answer. Go for mostly non-fiction. Any topic. What ever you’re interested in would be that best to go for. Like the civil war? There’s a book called The Civil War, if I’m not mistaken, that covers almost everything about it. Quantum Physics more your style? In Search Of Schrodinger's Cat covers the theories but not the mathematics. Prefer to think about ancient times? The Conqueror, about Alexander the Great, reads like a novel but is (more or less) historically true (warning- a little NSFW, so don’t read it in school). If you can’t find anything at your school, go to a local library. You can always find something there. The number of books you read depends heavily upon how fast you read. With a clear schedule, you could probably go one a week, depending on the book. With the things you have to deal with everyday, Don’t be disappointed if you only get through a book a month. The important thing isn’t how many books you’re reading- it’s the fact that you are reading. A lot of people put books down one they leave high school/college and never pick one up again. Even if you can only read a couple minutes a day, you are still improving your knowledge on whatever you read. And don’t be afraid to go back to non-fiction once in a while, cause even the most interesting topic gets boring after a while.

5 subjects are learning where 3 sub have textbook and practical book out of which 2 books have divided in two parts so, 3(prac.)+4(books of phy and chem)+1(bio or cs)=8. 1 sub is eng of 2 books( main textbook and supplementary reader). And the last sub is maths of two textbooks. So the total books are 8+2+2=12.
